item.title: Essay on Complexity
item.description: I am unable to move. The future promised more… More knowledge, more tools, more freedom of expression, more possibilities. The truth is though, as time has moved forward I have only felt the possibility shrinking. Our collective future compressing into a single point that is the future. Perhaps this is always how aging feels. A feeling of fewer possbilities from a horizon that is much closer than you thought it was at first glance, but I am not so certain that this feeling comes from the same aging people before us experienced.

item.title: GalliumOS Screenshot settings
item.description: *GalliumOS *uses xfce4 which is a Linux desktop environment. xfce4 uses something called xfce screenshooter which is the built in screenshot application. (it may actually be seperate but it comes with GalliumOS) You can go to keyboard settings in GalliumOS and change the command that is run to screenshot a selection instead of the entire screen. In my case I used the command xfce4-screenshooter -c -r

item.title: Getting Images and files to load on hugo
item.description: Relative links with Hugo The Hugo static site generator does not support relative links to files. Instead, it expects you to link to other pages using the [ref and relref shortcodes]. As a result of this, notes that have been exported from Obsidian using obsidian-export do not work out of the box because Hugo doesn’t resolve these links correctly. Markdown Render Hooks (only supported using the default goldmark renderer) allow you to work around this issue however, making exported notes work with Hugo after a bit of one-time setup work.

item.title: Gettint HTML to lad on hugo
item.description: html will not load unless the following is added to Hugo Apr 2, 2021 Render raw html in HUGO markdown files By default Hugo will not render embedded html in markdown files. To enable, add the following lines to config.toml: [markup.goldmark.renderer] unsafe = true Entering the raw html: <h1>hello world!</h1> Renders: hello world! Source: https://jasonmurray.org/posts/2021/hugohtml/

item.title: Latex Writitng Software
item.description: Supposedly this allows you to create templates for writing a book. Should take a look at it later. It seems that this tool is very similar to markdown, but is good for writing math, and great for creating printed work. That is to say, it is good if you are making an exam or a book. It is a bit less good if you want to create something that can be displayed online.

item.title: Obsidian-Export
item.description: obsidian-export This tool is used to convert obsidian notes into a structure that can be used by Hugo. //I should write out instructions on how to use it here I was able to convert my notes into something that can be used by hugo, but images did not work. the link used has two dots. If I change it to one dot does it work? I also need to create front matter in my pages so things like title and author show.

item.title: Rotations
item.description: Rotations I have spent most of my life trying to curate something I will call a rotation. This concept comes from the games I played as a child. In these games you were wizards and warriors, rogues and witch doctors, Knights and Healers. Each one of these had a set of tools that was good for handling different situations. They complimented and countered each other. As you played the game, you would collect different spells, attacks, and support skills.

item.title: Schrödinger's cat
item.description: This one is complicated. I think this will be much higher level. To explain it truly well I pretty much have to learn quantum physics.

item.title: The First Chapter
item.description: I could write a million different books on every subject. I could write a giant book on math and science. Perhaps one on statistics (though I probably will write something on statistics). I could dig deep and learn hardware in order to bring you an expert education on building computers from scratch. This all seems like the wrong approach though. There are people out there who do this better than I, and perhaps more than anything the best thing I can do is point you in their direction, but I think I can do one better than that.

item.title: Website
item.description: Need to find a website that can be generated by markdown documents like obsidian and can do links like obsidian. I found something before, but I will need to dig around and try to find it again. I want a very fast way to generate webpages without having to try too hard. If I can generate traffic, perhaps I will be able to do something with that traffic. 3m ago

item.title: Welcome
item.description: This site is automatically generated as I type out my notes. There are a couple of steps to reach this goal, but they are not many, and the lessons learned while doing this will help you dip your toe into a computer science tool or two. Open Chromium Let’s start simple. The first thing you are going to do is open chromium in the bottom left corner of the laptop. This step is so easy you may have already done so.

There are a couple of steps to reach this goal, but they are not many, and the lessons learned while doing this will help you dip your toe into a computer science tool or two. Open Chromium Let’s start simple. The first thing you are going to do is open chromium in the bottom left corner of the laptop. This step is so easy you may have already done so.

item.title: Welcome to Magic Book
item.description: Hello! Come in! Come in! It is great to have you here at the gates of my personal journal. With pages that cannot be burned and words viewable from anywhere in the world. A ‘magic book’ you might say. Now that might sound grandiose. “Magic!? This is technology. Don’t be silly.” I assure you that this would be indiscernible magic to the scribes of ancient china nearly 3000 years ago when printing books required hand carved text in wooden blocks.

item.title: What is the magic book?
item.description: As magical as the world may be, at some point I am going to have to get technical if I wish to communicate anything of use to you. I have created this site as a way of instantly converting my personal notes into a website which can easily be reached by anyone. The vast majority of resources in the world have one goal. To extract as much value from you as possible.

item.title: What is the magic book?
item.description: As magical as the world may be, at some point I am going to have to get technical if I wish to communicate anything of use to you. I have created this site as a way of instantly converting my personal notes into a website which can easily be reached by anyone. The vast majority of resources in the world have one goal. To extract as much value from you as possible.

Gamification The game makes the player, makes the game, makes the player. Humans are not well suited to dealing with the growing complexity that exists in society today. Historically speaking, the game we were in had the following traits. Essentially infinite resources Resource limitation was set by ability to collect and store resources. Pollution was a local worry, but not a global one. Social circles were limited in size. the power of an individual to inflict damage on ecosystems was fairly limited by their technology The balance of manpower vs technology was not so lopsided, though still lopsided.

Artificial intelligence is a misnomer we use to characterize intelligence that humans created. I would argue that there is only intelligence. Even Earth itself shows some amount of intelligence, if it did not, you and I would not be here. So calling it artificial really only serves as a shorter version of ‘that intelligence that we made’. When I was little, I never imagined that I might one day understand on a basic level how the brain actually functions.
Blender is a free 3d graphics software with many different uses. It is focused on being an artistic software rather than one used for precision.

bookmarklets are javascript code, other tricks, put into a bookmark. You can put everything that you can put in the browsers address bar inside of a bookmark. This can lead to all sorts of tricks being possible within a bookmark. So far I have 3 tricks that I use regularly now. Copying preset text to a clipboard Using an alert to display a message to the user Using an input to generate a dynamic https:// link I will probably use this to search specific things very quickly such as creating a bookmark that limits your search to a specific domain.

Coda.io is similar to Obsidian, with the notable difference that it… Costs money, and is more expensive than Notion Allows you to display your writing online in a visually pleasing way allows for inline database features, though it can only handle about 10k rows before crumpling, at least at this moment. The pace at which they were adding features I would not be surprised if they surpassed this by now.

https://html.com/resources/cookies-ultimate-guide/ I will likely need to use cookies to ‘save the players game This goes over the more technical aspects. https://www.section.io/engineering-education/understanding-and-working-with-javascript-cookies/#various-types-of-cookies Understanding and Working with JavaScript Cookies Bernard Mburu August 6, 2021 A cookie is a short text file that stores some data on a computer (about 4KB). They usually keep track of information such as preferencess for a website, prompting the user to improve the web page the next time they visit.

table title, event_date from #events sort event_date desc An event is anything that happened at a specific point in time. Through tracking events in history as accurately as possible, we may learn what truth is. Ideally an event should attempt to accurately encapsulate the event, the causes and affects, the players involved (businesses) hopefully by keeping track of these things I can begin to hone in on the most important drivers of our modern times.
Website + Magic Mirror

Coming home from Abby’s. Yesterday was her birthday. Aaron and her seem like they are doing well. Abby’s Dad has cancer, her new bird died, but they got two to replace it. Amanda, Abby’s mom, played VR for the first time yesterday. Super Hot, Beat Sabre, Walkabout Mini-Golf, and the First Steps introduction games. Nellie had a good time. I am glad that she took my advice and got the mini golf game.

#deepdive This counts as a deep dive, but due to its importance, I have put it on the front page. The human body requires maintenance in order to function properly, but our body is not very good at driving us to take care of ourselves properly. It may have been good in the past, but industry has become very good at driving us towards activities that are no good for us.

While gimp may not have all the bells and whistles that Photoshop has, it runs fast, it is completely free, and you can edit photos in it.What else do you need. I have never seen a perfect photo editing software yet. They are all too complicated for what you want to do, too crashy, too slow, and common features seem too hard to access. Maybe one day a killer app will come out that is better than Photoshop, but I don’t know when that will be.
some markdown

When most people speak of low level and high level programming languages, they can be talking about two different, but related things. One of these is the trade off between speed of writing the code, and speed of the code when it is being run. The other relates to how we write the code. The lower the level of programming, the closer to machine code the language is. The higher the level, the closer to human thought the language is.
Inkscape may very well be the most intuitive vector art software I have ever used. Free too.

An insight is a tiny but powerful bit of knowledge. Some of this is self evident such as mathematical proofs. Some of it you must take on some amount of faith and should be backed up with studies. How much gas does an idling car use Electricity usage of different appliances map of linux distributions how the sun goes around earth Odds of dice rolls brain measures difference in color - image all the material that has been mined in the world periodic table based on amount of material in existence
An interpreted language does not require that the language be compiled before it is ran. There is some loss of speed due to this, but since you don’t have to compile, you can experiment very quickly.

In my opinion, Notion is a weaker Coda.io. I think the biggest benefit of Notion is that it is less expensive than Coda.io. You still get most of the features of Coda, but it feels jankier overall and far less powerful.

I have read a million things talking about object oriented programming, and I am not sure if the general notion stacks up honestly. I find that often the type of program you are writing informs the style of writing you should create. The idea behind object oriented programming is that you try to package up all your code as ‘objects’. Usually this ends with someone describing a car, and how a car has an engine, and that engine runs on gas, which is provided by a tank.

The software you are likely using to read or write this. The core benefit that Obsidian has as far as I am concerned is the ability to create links to new documents by typing [[link name here]]. If you want to do this in anything else you need to create the document, create some content for the document and then navigate to the document you wish to link from and insert the hard link to that document.

Tools, Methods, Drills, Events, Insights. A library for processing (mostly tabular) data. Allows you to import, mess with, and export csv’s, excel sheets etc. Very similar to R language

Python is an easy to use language that is relatively slow, but is often used in cases where speed does not matter. From the python website itself with links to these concepts provided by me. Python is an interpreted, object-oriented programming, high-level programming language with dynamic semantics. Its high-level built in data structures, combined with dynamic typing and dynamic binding, make it very attractive for Rapid Application Development, as well as for use as a scripting or glue language to connect existing components together.

Dude I have no fucking idea. I am sure I can collect some information, but I don’t think there is an easy answer to this one. My gut tells me that you need to challenge them in ways that they don’t even realize they are being challenged. Give them entertainment that challenges them, have them around people so they are challenged to interact socially. Make sure you feed them enough. Don’t do drugs while they are being birthed.
Its bullshit, but to understand why takes an understanding of human nature, logic, and statistics.

Compiling is when a language is translated into machine code, or some other code that can be run on a device. Often the language you are writing in is designed to be easy to use for humans, but cannot itself be used by a computer. Compiling translates the code so it can be run.
This page was created for the purpose of showing the linking functionality within obsidian.

A note taking style created by myself. Will it matter? We shall see! My method consists of the following objects Tools Tools are techniques, software, physical objects and more that can be used to create some desired outcome. If you find yourself coming back to it over and over again for many different applications, it is likely a good candidate for a tool. Methods Methods are a tool or combination of tools used in a specific way to create a specific outcome.

#project A tool is a software, object, institution or any other ‘thing’ that can be used to perform a task. Each one will tend to have a specific goal in mind when using it, but the use cases tend to be pretty broad.
